speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: SCENE II. Another part of the island.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Enter CALIBAN, STEPHANO, and TRINCULO

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Tell not me; when the butt is out, we will drink

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: water; not a drop before: therefore bear up, and

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: board 'em. Servant-monster, drink to me.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Servant-monster! the folly of this island! They

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: say there's but five upon this isle: we are three

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: of them; if th' other two be brained like us, the

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: state totters.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Drink, servant-monster, when I bid thee: thy eyes

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: are almost set in thy head.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Where should they be set else? he were a brave

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: monster indeed, if they were set in his tail.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: My man-monster hath drown'd his tongue in sack:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: for my part, the sea cannot drown me; I swam, ere I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: could recover the shore, five and thirty leagues off

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and on. By this light, thou shalt be my lieutenant,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: monster, or my standard.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Your lieutenant, if you list; he's no standard.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: We'll not run, Monsieur Monster.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Nor go neither; but you'll lie like dogs and yet say

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: nothing neither.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Moon-calf, speak once in thy life, if thou beest a

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: good moon-calf.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: How does thy honour? Let me lick thy shoe.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll not serve him; he's not valiant.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Thou liest, most ignorant monster: I am in case to

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: justle a constable. Why, thou deboshed fish thou,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: was there ever man a coward that hath drunk so much

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: sack as I to-day? Wilt thou tell a monstrous lie,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: being but half a fish and half a monster?

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Lo, how he mocks me! wilt thou let him, my lord?

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: 'Lord' quoth he! That a monster should be such a natural!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Lo, lo, again! bite him to death, I prithee.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Trinculo, keep a good tongue in your head: if you

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: prove a mutineer,--the next tree! The poor monster's

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: my subject and he shall not suffer indignity.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I thank my noble lord. Wilt thou be pleased to

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: hearken once again to the suit I made to thee?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Marry, will I kneel and repeat it; I will stand,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and so shall Trinculo.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Enter ARIEL, invisible

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: As I told thee before, I am subject to a tyrant, a

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: sorcerer, that by his cunning hath cheated me of the island.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Thou liest.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou liest, thou jesting monkey, thou: I would my

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: valiant master would destroy thee! I do not lie.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Trinculo, if you trouble him any more in's tale, by

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: this hand, I will supplant some of your teeth.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Why, I said nothing.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Mum, then, and no more. Proceed.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I say, by sorcery he got this isle;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: From me he got it. if thy greatness will

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Revenge it on him,--for I know thou darest,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: But this thing dare not,--

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: That's most certain.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou shalt be lord of it and I'll serve thee.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: How now shall this be compassed?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Canst thou bring me to the party?

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Yea, yea, my lord: I'll yield him thee asleep,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Where thou mayst knock a nail into his bead.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Thou liest; thou canst not.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: What a pied ninny's this! Thou scurvy patch!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I do beseech thy greatness, give him blows

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And take his bottle from him: when that's gone

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: He shall drink nought but brine; for I'll not show him

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Where the quick freshes are.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Trinculo, run into no further danger:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: interrupt the monster one word further, and,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: by this hand, I'll turn my mercy out o' doors

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and make a stock-fish of thee.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Why, what did I? I did nothing. I'll go farther

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: off.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Didst thou not say he lied?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Thou liest.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Do I so? take thou that.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Beats TRINCULO

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: As you like this, give me the lie another time.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I did not give the lie. Out o' your

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: wits and bearing too? A pox o' your bottle!

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: this can sack and drinking do. A murrain on

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: your monster, and the devil take your fingers!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Ha, ha, ha!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Now, forward with your tale. Prithee, stand farther

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: off.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Beat him enough: after a little time

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll beat him too.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Stand farther. Come, proceed.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Why, as I told thee, 'tis a custom with him,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I' th' afternoon to sleep: there thou mayst brain him,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Having first seized his books, or with a log

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Batter his skull, or paunch him with a stake,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Or cut his wezand with thy knife. Remember

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: First to possess his books; for without them

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: He's but a sot, as I am, nor hath not

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: One spirit to command: they all do hate him

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: As rootedly as I. Burn but his books.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: He has brave utensils,--for so he calls them--

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Which when he has a house, he'll deck withal

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And that most deeply to consider is

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The beauty of his daughter; he himself

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Calls her a nonpareil: I never saw a woman,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: But only Sycorax my dam and she;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: But she as far surpasseth Sycorax

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: As great'st does least.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Is it so brave a lass?

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Ay, lord; she will become thy bed, I warrant.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And bring thee forth brave brood.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Monster, I will kill this man: his daughter and I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: will be king and queen--save our graces!--and

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Trinculo and thyself shall be viceroys. Dost thou

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: like the plot, Trinculo?

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Excellent.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Give me thy hand: I am sorry I beat thee; but,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: while thou livest, keep a good tongue in thy head.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Within this half hour will he be asleep:

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Wilt thou destroy him then?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Ay, on mine honour.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: This will I tell my master.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou makest me merry; I am full of pleasure:

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Let us be jocund: will you troll the catch

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: You taught me but while-ere?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: At thy request, monster, I will do reason, any

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: reason. Come on, Trinculo, let us sing.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Sings

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Flout 'em and scout 'em

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: And scout 'em and flout 'em

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Thought is free.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: That's not the tune.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Ariel plays the tune on a tabour and pipe

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: What is this same?

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: This is the tune of our catch, played by the picture

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: of Nobody.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: If thou beest a man, show thyself in thy likeness:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: if thou beest a devil, take't as thou list.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: O, forgive me my sins!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: He that dies pays all debts: I defy thee. Mercy upon us!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Art thou afeard?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: No, monster, not I.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Be not afeard; the isle is full of noises,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Sounds and sweet airs, that give delight and hurt not.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Sometimes a thousand twangling instruments

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Will hum about mine ears, and sometime voices

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: That, if I then had waked after long sleep,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Will make me sleep again: and then, in dreaming,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The clouds methought would open and show riches

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Ready to drop upon me that, when I waked,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I cried to dream again.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This will prove a brave kingdom to me, where I shall

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: have my music for nothing.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: When Prospero is destroyed.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: That shall be by and by: I remember the story.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: The sound is going away; let's follow it, and

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: after do our work.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Lead, monster; we'll follow. I would I could see

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: this tabourer; he lays it on.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Wilt come? I'll follow, Stephano.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Exeunt
